doldrums.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if an industry, company, activity etc is in the doldrums, it is not doing well or developing
doldrums.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Recent economic doldrums have damaged the rural west.
The property market has been in the doldrums for months.
doldrums.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if you are in the doldrums, you are feeling sad
doldrums.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Fay is in the doldrums today.
doldrums.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if an industry or market is in the doldrums, there is very little increase in prices or very little trade taking place
doldrums.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The mortgage market has been in the doldrums for three years but now business is picking up.
